articles.title: Asia markets shaky after Trump trade comments
articles.description: Stocks mixed after Trump says he does not ‘anticipate much’ from US-China trade talks

articles.title: Dollar weakens further after Trump says ‘not thrilled’ by Fed
articles.description: The dollar continued to fall while the euro and yen firmed on Tuesday after Donald Trump’s criticised the Federal Reserve overnight and as expectations mellowed ahead of trade talks between US and China later this week.

articles.title: Chinese stocks climb despite Trump downplaying trade talks
articles.description: Chinese stocks rose across the board on Tuesday despite Donald Trump downplaying expectations for upcoming US-China trade talks.

articles.title: US stock futures higher but dollar slips on Trump remarks
articles.description: US stock futures tip Wall Street for a higher open as investors eye upcoming trade talks between the US and China while the dollar edged lower after President Donald Trump criticised the Federal Reserve.

articles.title: S&P 500 hits record high on the path to a record bull market
articles.description: The S&P 500 hit a record high on Tuesday, surpassing its previous peak in January and as the benchmark equalled the longest postwar bull market in US history.

articles.title: JPMorgan plan to launch new trading programme sends discount brokers tumbling
articles.description: Shares in online brokerages dropped in early trading on news that JPMorgan plans to introduce a new digital brokerage service that features commission-free trading of stocks and exchange traded funds.

articles.description: Politics interrupt positive streak

articles.title: Dollar, stocks shaky in Asia after Trump hits out at Fed
articles.description: The dollar lost more ground and stocks were lower in early Asia-Pacific trading on Tuesday after Donald Trump’s latest broadside at the US central bank overnight.

articles.title: Oil builds momentum with fourth day of gains
articles.description: Is the pain finally over for oil bulls? Oil prices are on track for their fourth straight session of gains, suggesting a possible end is in sight to several weeks of steady declines.

articles.title: Italian government bonds rally after Moody’s extends ratings review
articles.description: Prices on Italian government debt got a boost on Tuesday after Moody’s extended the deadline for its review into a potential downgrade of the country’s credit rating.

articles.title: Stocks hit all-time highs for the first time since January
articles.description: The S&P 500 rose to a new high on Tuesday for the first time since January 26. On Wednesday, this bull market will become the longest ever. Strong earnings growth continues to power the stock market in the face of trade disputes, higher interest rates, and ot…
